website_summaries.verdict: Canon's PowerShot SX60 HS is one of the top bridge cameras in its class thanks to improved design, useful features, excellent photos and video and -- of course -- its really wide and really long lens.
pros: The Canon PowerShot SX60 HS is an all-around excellent bridge camera with a competitive zoom range, features that make it easier to use and make use of the lens and solid photo and video quality for its class
cons: Like most cameras in this category, the SX60 can be slow to lock focus when fully zoomed in under certain conditions
Switching between the viewfinder and display is still frustrating and there's no proximity sensor to automatically trigger the change either
Pixel peepers likely won't be impressed with its photos, especially indoors or in low-light

customer_reviews.title: sx60 vs p900
customer_reviews.text: sx60 - Nice camera! I really want to like the nikon p900, but after taking some photos with the p900 I was disappointed. After passing 70 - 85 x optical zoom image get blurry here are some photos to compare between the sx60 - p900
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this camera for the zoom and it is amazing. I took pictures of a man on a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for the zoom and it is amazing. I took pictures of a man on a scaffold painting ( you could barley see the man he was so far away)...took the pic and zoomed in, you can actually see the stitching in the cap he was wearing. I am using it mainly for moon photography and it is unbelievable. I am shooting moon pics handheld and get better results than with a tripod. I think this is because when you put the camera on a tripod it disengages the image stabilization. I take moon pics every night it is available and they are amazing. The camera is also great for regular photography.
customer_reviews.author: rd

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CAMERA!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this camera!!! The zoom is amazing!!! The wi-fi is so convenient and simple to use. I am attaching pictures I took at a rookery and will let them tell the rest of the review. Also Amazon is just the best!! Customer service gets 5 stars all the way from me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Wildlife Camera
customer_reviews.text: Spent a lot of time reading about this vs. the Nikon P900. In the end I chose the Canon, even though the zoom wasn't quite as long. The camera is smaller and lighter than the Nikon and for what I want, there is plenty of zoom. Can't possibly be used without a monopod or tripod in any significant zoom mode, but I a super pleased with the quality of the shots so far. Excellent for wildlife. Of course I had to shoot the moon just because everyone does, and that is cool, but I really like it for shooting birds and other wildlife.
customer_reviews.author: Flyfisher

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE ROUND SHOULDERS
customer_reviews.text: My wife, Naomi, and I used to carry a bunch of lenses, as well as a video camera until we discovered this gem. No longer are we bogged down with equipment. This does it all, and in fine style. Good bye Leica, and Canon Eos system. This is all we need for our travels. I just wish that it had a remote device.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H

customer_reviews.title: 1 MP camera is the best camera of this type I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The PowerShot SX60 HS 16.1 MP camera is the best camera of this type I have ever owned. I do inspections that often requires several hundreds of photos per day with as many as a thousand or more a week, The camera battery life is great. Sharp quick focus for well lit areas as well as low light. Easy to use and has become the favorite for everyday shooting. I thought our SX50 12.1 MP was great until I used the SX60 16.1 MP.
customer_reviews.author: W. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SX60 is a great wildlife camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best field camera I have owned. I use it mostly for photographing birds and other wildlife and if carefully aimed and held firmly it takes excellent shots without a tripod even at maximum (1365mm) telephoto range. It is easy to use, the battery lasts as long as I need and the charging system is neat and recharges fairly quickly. It's light weight has just about eliminated my use of my much heavier EOS-30 camera with 400mm stabilized telephoto lens! There are many features that I haven't even had time to explore as yet but even so I am most pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great features but some of them
customer_reviews.text: Great features but some of them, such as NFC and Wi-Fi, are very complicated to use. And having only an on-line user manual (over 200 pages long) makes it impractical to print the whole thing out. I love the camera (I previously owned the SX50) but wish that Canon hadn't eliminated the user manual in booklet form.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Loebel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I had the previous model. The zoom on this one is much better. I keep it on the automatic setting most of the time and it takes incredible pictures. It uses the same batteries as the previous model. Battery life is the same, maybe a bit better than the previous model. It takes really nice video also.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: A good snapshot camera for those that was a bit more
customer_reviews.text: I love that this camera is so versatile. i can shoot macro to the point of the lens touching the subject, and then zoom in on far away things. I do doubt I’ll every try for a longer zoom lens simply because I do sometimes feel the focus is a bit off on zoomed in photos. And sometimes switching between various photographic modes is a bit tricky. But the camera does a good job and I’ve taken it with me everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Skydiver

customer_reviews.title: Probably going to want a tripod
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera on a trip to the lake and was able to get shots that clearly showed the eyes of birds a good distance away. Everyone was very impressed by my obligatory moon shots, except for me, because I saw how clear they were BEFORE the tiny motions of my body disrupted things. Somebody thought I was a professional photographer. My mom's roommate, who is actually a professional photographer, was also impressed by the zoom, and started asking me a bunch of technical questions, but I was so caught off guard I could barely remember the brand clearly printed on both the camera and the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this camera. I wanted a more powerful camera without the hassle of focusing or changing lenses. I have used this camera in National and State Parks with wonderful results. The settings and zoom is easy to understand and use. The camera isn't heavy, but I do have a padded camera strap. I am enjoying using the camera and then reviewing all the pictures and memories. This camera is simple to use but has all the settings to satisfy a more ambitious casual photographer for kids sports to landscapes and landmarks.
customer_reviews.author: SavvyLady

customer_reviews.title: Great Point and Shoot for Wildlife Photography
customer_reviews.text: After reading MANY reviews I purchased the Canon Powershot SX60 over the Nikon P900. Image quality is much more important than the extra zoom that the P900 provided. It is important that I can shoot in RAW. I use Adobe Lightroom for editing. I purchased this camera for wildlife photography and I will provide an update after I return from a safari. So far with limited shots it exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Mashman

customer_reviews.title: Cannon SX60
customer_reviews.text: To tell you the truth I thought I was ordering an SX40...duh...when it arrived I noticed it was a SX6. I've had these cameras for many years and just really like everything about them except the tiny controls. I make an effort with my large hand to operate this but performance is top notch...stills and videos..the zoom is beyond compare...
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome zoom without a tripod
customer_reviews.text: Have owned various models of this camera. The latest in this line has the same quality as its predecessors. The zoom is quite awesome even without a tripod. It does easily connect, even with our lousy internet service, to my network and quickly transfers to my smartphone. I primarily use this camera for taking bird and wildflower photographs. Very pleased and I love the separate viewfinder and LCD screen. Much easier to use than trying to focus only through an LCD screen, especially on a sunny day. Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shell

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, returned because of grainy sounding zoom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for filming wildlife from afar. I like it, the only reason i sent it back was the zoom sounded grainy, which bothered me a lot for some reason. It didnt come with the lanyard for the lens cap or the neck strap which bothered me. Im trying the fz80 now, if that doesnt work, Ill buy a better quality sx60.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Point & Shoot Super Zoom Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my Powershot SX60. When my Powershot SX50 zoom was sticking due to the age, I decided to try the Nikon point and shot super zoom. I ended up with Nikon P900 which I returned because I was not impressed and purchased the P610. I have kept the P610 but I really was not happy with it. So purchase the Powershot SX60k and so impressed. It is light and you do not have to carry extra lens. I have only had a couple of days but so glad I purchased it. I even used it for some Macro shots yesterday and equally impressed
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Tea

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The zoom is killer. Great for pulling distant wild life up close. It takes a little practice getting clear focus. Automatic is great for indoor shots. Picture quality is above acceptable but not as good as DSLR camera. I would have liked getting a copy of user manual with camera instead of having to download.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera for Nature Shots
customer_reviews.text: I would not trade this camera for anything. I have gotten beautiful nature photo's with this camera. This is the camera for people who like to do a lot of nature photography. I have two expensive camera's but I use this Canon powershot instead of the expensive camera's and I get beautiful photo's with it. I am actually thinking about buying a second one in case something would happen to the one that I have. Thanks Canon for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joan M. Granruth

customer_reviews.title: The best camera on the market for me
customer_reviews.text: This camera fully meets and exceeds my expectations. Zoom feature is especially important. The camera makes good quality pictures in different light conditions. I do not use fancy features, and the camera works well in its "default" mode even with its basic features. No need to change lenses!
customer_reviews.author: GO

customer_reviews.title: Great for birding, sports, or other superzoom things. Otherwise. . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Cheap feeling plastic. Outstanding camera for its intended purpose as a "superzoom" but lacking for general use if the zoom is not needed. Image quality is expected for such a small sensor. Easy to use. Simplistic. Great value given the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimouse

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for the experienced amateur
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Canon Powershot cameras over the years, and like the others, this one offers outstanding value for the price. I was using it with confidence right out of the box. The extended zoom lens lets me get really close to my subjects, which are often birds. I do recommend the camera be coupled with top of the line noise software, as that can be a problem at the longest zoom, but I've gotten some gorgeous photos. I use a tripod when it's handy, but I often shoot handheld with excellent clarity. Most of the pics I've included were taken at the longest zoom possible. I then post-processed in Photoshop with Topaz Adjust and DeNoise.
customer_reviews.author: LSK

customer_reviews.title: Not for the faint of heart
customer_reviews.text: First off, the downloadable PDF manual is bad at best. The exposure range is not wide enough. This camera has a huge number of settings which can be changed, BUT you may not get the results you expected (test everything). I do Love the 65x telephoto range, and the macro function works well. The more I experiment, the better my results, but takes a lot of time (glad I'm not buying film)!
customer_reviews.author: Diver

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic on my 23 day trip to Africa. I went with Professional Photographers so I learned how to take better shots on manual. The camera is very good but it's not for Professional pictures. The settings have limitations. This camera is great for above average pictures but not good enough for long distance money shots. At the time I bought this it had the highest zoom without having to change lens. That's why I picked it and the Professional Photographer helped me choose it.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: this camera is beyond amazing, I'm using it for bird watching and I can't believe how up close I can get to the birds, seeing the details in their feathers and the expressions on their faces. this was the perfect camera for me. any less zoom would not have met my needs, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Jogger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best $400 lens I've ever owned and they throw in the camera for free.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Garreau

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good upgrade from the SX 50 HS. The extra zoom, higher megapixels and larger dots in the viewfinder and the LCD display are nice additions! It is a little larger, but the functions are easier to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Missed the Mark
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my Canon Powershot SX50 and was excited to upgrade to the SX60. Soooo disappointed! Video looks hyper-realistic and appears to be sped up. The focus when fully zoomed isn't as crisp on this model either. Makes me hesitate about purchasing a SX70...if Canon ever releases it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Canon SX 50 HS
customer_reviews.text: I have owned both the SX 50 and the SX 60. The auto focus does not perform as well on the SX 60. The only advantage that I see is the external microphone port
customer_reviews.author: Kirt

customer_reviews.title: Love it more than my DSLR (almost)
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the SX50, and this is a big improvement. The optical viewfinder on this model actually lets you clearly see the image, so you're not bound to the LCD screen. The Bluetooth and wi-fi camapilities are fantastic. I haven't found anything to complain about! Great camera to go with my DSLR (in fact, I use it more than I use my 30D now).
customer_reviews.author: Allen W. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: So Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Had an older camera from Canon, similar but had various lenses and found it too bulky and hard to use most of the time. We were always reaching for the smaller, portable cameras or our cell phones for pics. Last year Hubby bought a small compact camera that was over $500 and he wishes he saved the money. A friend showed us this camera and the images he took with it - had to get one! Takes great pictures. Animals, scenic, whatever. Easy to use and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Buy USA!

customer_reviews.title: Getting some great pics with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Getting some great pics with this camera. First thing I wanted to do was photograph the moon at full zoom. The pictures were amazing...had to post them on my FB account! My friends were asking me what telescope I was using to get the craters and other details so nice. I was even able to capture Jupiter and 4 of her moons! I am experimenting with the video part of the camera right now. I noticed that the raw MP4 videos are sluggish on two of our computers, but I think after converting them to a DVD format they will be fine. All in all it is a great camera for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ray M. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid camera with many features. It might be daunting for the digital camera novice or someone with little computer skill, and the extras are geared toward WiFi use, but the electronic user's manual is written in easy-to-understand language and there's a comfortable learning curve from basic point-and-shoot to movies. ( Note that a memory card is not included. Neither is a USB cable so have one handy if you intend to download images directly to your PC without WiFi.)
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to Bigger Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera- very high quality crisp and clear photos on zoom, like the wider angle for longer shots. Some reviews have said low light photos not too good, but I'm having good luck so far. Mostly used auto mode so far, but starting to experiment on others- lots of modes that do way more than I will probably ever use, but might be fun to experiment. Fits hand well and all controls in very reachable/handy places. Like flash that needs to be raised manually- no risk of accidently flashing. Still small enough to wear in bag on belt. All in all very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Got it right the SECOND time....... LOVE this camera, so far
customer_reviews.text: Only had a few days, but so far, I LOVE it... Originally, I bought a FugiFilm S4200.. It was light, felt cheap, and lcd screen was fixed,and only a 24X zoom---returned it... The SX60 has a much heaver quality feel to it, 65x zoom, better neck strap.. I wanted AA battery power (Fugi had it), but the Canon has available Vivatar batteries I got from Amazon very reasonable.. A two pack w/ charger and other cleaning items was about $17 !!!! A Canon extra battery was about $40...
customer_reviews.author: usmc7274

customer_reviews.title: Great click and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Love the lightness of body, the capture hues are better and more true to actual color seen, and it has awesome range of distance in one automatic lens! From macro to 65x zoom! It has faster shutter speed than its last generation (SX50), but it is still a bit shaky when fully extended with the zoom. Very steady hand or make sure you have tripod for zooming pictures. Can see the craters on the moon--ONE lens!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: The feature set is excellent and I find that the photo quality is still ...
customer_reviews.text: My brother-in-law had one of these first and I was always jealous at the nature photos he was able to take compared to mine. I got hard to see dark spots in the distance and he got vibrant and detailed animals. This camera will not deliver the same quality photos that you would get with a DSLR but the ultra zoom allows you to get nature photos (and family photos) that you could not get with other much more expensive cameras. The feature set is excellent and I find that the photo quality is still very, very good. If you enjoy hiking and the outdoors this is a camera you need.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Light and compact  but not for sharp nature shots
customer_reviews.text: Some people love these... I AM a canon fan but did not have success with this particular camera for my intended use for a compact camera with substantial zoom for nature shots... birds, butterflies, critters in motion.... I just could not get the image to focus consistently for either the zoom mode or macros. For landscape and people, it’s great for a compact camera although my iPhone does great with that. I was trying to not carry big lenses when I hike. For me this wasnt the right camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Gilliom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera! Using it for nature photography! If you enlarge the attached photo, you can see the water beads on the ducks back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P. Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Like the powershot line this is my third I went ...
customer_reviews.text: What I wanted could've went up to a dslr but wanted something simpler and manual operation. Like the powershot line this is my third I went up the ladder. I am an old Nikon slr user and was looking for the quality in the wrong places. It seems to be in the software. Great lens 21mm to i think 250 not sure but it is in the specs. One thing I wish Canon did with this camera put a uv filter on the lens to protect it I gad to buy an adapter and new cap which was not as good
customer_reviews.author: augustusmax

customer_reviews.title: SX 60 super moon photos
customer_reviews.text: My SX50 wore out after many years of service and this camera does a great job! It has a slightly longer zoom with better video and newer processor. Here are a couple of shots I did on the super moon that were handheld with this camera. This is a great camera for taking still photographs of not moving objects in bright sunlight. It also does a pretty good job on the moon too. I am extremely happy with it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Neal

customer_reviews.title: Eye pice is back
customer_reviews.text: It is nice to have the eye piece, in addition to the screen, available for taking pictures and reviewing them. After taking a photo class, having fun using the different features for taking pictures . In addition to the Auto mode, there are many modes and features to use and enhance your photos .
customer_reviews.author: P H

customer_reviews.title: Great as always
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this style camera for years, and it is always what I need for work photography needs. The articulation on the screen is amazing. If you take a lot of photos with the flash, I would recommend the warranty, or understand in 12-18 months, you will need to get the flash replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I loved the microphone jack and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I loved the microphone jack and the shoe on top. I'm more of a Nikon guy, but still enjoyed this camera. A point and shoot with professional quality and an amazing zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Impressive telephoto and video quality its size. However slow autofocus and extremely cumbersome manual focus definately limit its usefulness for outdoor/nature photography.
customer_reviews.author: hr

customer_reviews.title: She's loving this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Birthday gift for the wifey. 10 years ago she got a Canon point and shoot with 22x optical zoom for Christmas and has been using it happilly, since, having taken thousands of pics. She had recently commented that she could maybe be happier with a more powerful zoom, so, another Canon had to be in her future. I gave this to her yesterday and she had absolutely nothing negative to say about its zooming or image quality. She's happy, I'm happy. Get yourself one and/or give one and feel the happy !!!!
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: And the Pics go on
customer_reviews.text: continuation of a long tradition. Have an SX2, Had an SX10 Have an SX40 the SX60 lets me reach out further. Some other nice features such as WIFI puts the icing on the cake. Fantastic Pics in the past, and some very good pics with the new cam.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. I upgraded from an old Canon S3IS, which died. The magnification is great and picture quality is satisfying. Not great in low light. Looked at Niko. P900, but like the smaller size of the Canon., which is also huge.
customer_reviews.author: VBonz

customer_reviews.title: nikon p600 vs sx60 hs
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because I found a cheaper version but I love this camera. It does RAW which was the main reason I chose it over Nikons P600. Also has a much more professional feel and seems to have a faster processing all-around. It doesnt offer quite the same shutter speed as the p600 (1/2000 vs 1/4000) but still seems to capture better for my use. I am by no means a professional but I did choose this over the p600 after testing both.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Magnusson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera for small price
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, some of my friends who have professional cameras already asked me if I want to exchange with them. If you dont know how to adjust some settings it won't be good as you can read around so if you are beginer ask someone to show you how everything works and you'll get amazing pictures. One of the best things about this camera is moon shoot, I got one yesterday without stativ with my shaking hands and everyone I how it is amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love the new Canon Power Shot camera. I had an XS40 previously so I knew the quality of the camera and this one has newer features. I would recommend this camera to anyone who enjoys photography. The zoom on it is great!
customer_reviews.author: kwpeachey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a mom on the go
customer_reviews.text: I had the SX40 until my husband decided he liked it. Bought this as my replacement and I love it so far. I am just a mom who likes to take good pics of her kids and family doing everything from baseball/football to ballet to fishing and hunting on the weekends. I don't have the time to dedicate to learn a DSLR at the moment so this is a nice compromise. Takes great pics and video.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Lynn McCullers

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if I just got a bad one, or if it's the camera overall
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this camera. First it would pause really long between being able to take a picture. So I upgraded my SD card (the new Rebel my sister got had no trouble with my original SD card). The focus is also way, way off. I tried to take pictures in a fairly well lit cafeteria during a high school banquet and none of the pictures were usable. Tried again at my nieces dance recital and all completely blurry. I don't know if I just got a bad one, or if it's the camera overall. I'm sending it back and hoping for better luck with another camera.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lile

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Took this on an African safari, and took phenomenal shots with the ultrazoom. Got shots most other people couldn't get (except for people with much more expensive cameras, such as SLRs with bulky lens attachments. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Yukon Jack

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera for its zoom capacity which has allowed ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera for its zoom capacity which has allowed me to take much better photos of birds and wildlife than I could before even with my Sony DSLR. The one area that is a disappointment is shooting in low light situations. I took stunning photos of the full moon, but the next night I could not get good shots of the moon in eclipse even with a tripod. Other than that, I love the camera and being able to download photos to my phone easily!
customer_reviews.author: C. A Connerly

customer_reviews.title: Truly loved my SX40
customer_reviews.text: Truly loved my SX40. After many years and some hard drops, I decided to eagerly upgrade to the SX60. For whatever reason the picture quality is just not the same as my SX40. I am not a professional photographer, but I can see the differences in quality. Perhaps I should have returned it and got another SX60.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Forget the moon.
customer_reviews.text: I traded in the SX50 HS expecting to get even better moon shots. All the shots are soft, no craters, nothing. Outdoor day shots are superb. Indoors are OK. I may trade in for gulp, the Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Soulflower

customer_reviews.title: what I was wanting - I tend to carry a ...
customer_reviews.text: what I was wanting - I tend to carry a camera with me and this is fairly compact for a quick grab and shoot when I see something I want to take a picture of. I have another camera that requires focusing and changing lens, but that's not really the way I work. Also the extra length on my other camera gives me trouble focusing and holding steady. No problem here and the closeup is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Would sugget buying a used SX-50 instead
customer_reviews.text: After having this unit for a little more than a year, the incredibly poor performance of shooting video in mid-to-low light is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jvise

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I was tired of carrying around my DSLR and a bunch of lenses. The zoom on this camera was great. I was able to get close-ups of the animals from a distance at the Animal Kingdom.
customer_reviews.author: Botanical Artist

customer_reviews.title: It is much more useful at following small birds moving through the foliage of ...
customer_reviews.text: A vast improvement over my previous SX30. It is much more useful at following small birds moving through the foliage of trees. The photos I'm able to obtain of large flying birds at long distance is truly impressive, and is partly attributable to the rapid burst mode of the camera. Plus, the level of detail present in photos of birds even after cropping is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Pike

customer_reviews.title: I love the new model
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a very aged Cannon Powershot S5 IS with this. I love the new model. Pictures are great, the zoom is great, it is just as easy to use. The only thing I don't like are the rocker buttons. They are harder to press than the older model. My thumb hurts after a while using them. Never had that problem with the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Arpad

customer_reviews.title: Quality point-and-shoot replacement camera
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a Nikon that went in for repair. Tried a DSLR, but too heavy, too combersome, too much work. This camera has a phenomenal zoom, is slightly faster taking shots, and gives me quality photos that I can expand. Natural cropping gives me the pictures I want.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with  phenomenal zoom
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera with an INSANE zoom range. Used it to take close up photos of the moon in detail. Check out the SX60videos on youtube. The camera has a live viewfinder as well as the LCD screen, so buy extra batteries they use a lot of power.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.P

customer_reviews.title: Easy and good
customer_reviews.text: The image stabilization makes the telephoto lens much more useable. It works seamlessly on a tripod or hand held panning or still. I took telephoto shots that show me detail that I could not see with binoculars. You could spend weeks learning all the features or just point and shoot and get better pictures that may surprise you.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Tom

customer_reviews.title: Bird photo best: amazing zoom and stabilization
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I had one of its predecessors for years but got this one in time for the spring birding season. High zoom image stabilization is so amazing. Great for bird photos!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Research your options.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this camera since I got a much better deal on a similar camera via an Amazon "Lightning Deal". I would comment that there are a ton of reviews out there on this and similar super zooms. I recommend doing a lot of research to see what strikes you as most pertinent for your needs. Some reviews seem to be just personal opinions without any real comparisons. I found a great review of super zooms that included actual comparative photo tests. Here is a link to a great review of camera options from 2014
customer_reviews.author: Ron V

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite camera, tlo date. Love my moon shots...and wildlife from afar,
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I've Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my PowerShot S5IS. I love the multi-positionable viewing screen, very powerful telephoto, WI-FI connectability, and very dense file size capability. The latter means I can make after-the-shot improvements to the exposure or composition and still have a very high-quality image to project or print. I would definitely recommend this to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: William B. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money!! Camera is excellent. Highly recommend it to everyone. The zoom makes you feel like you are sitting right next to what you are taking a photo of. Very easy to operate, easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: howard

customer_reviews.title: Can't Get Much Better
customer_reviews.text: This is the best price I've found for this camera. Most other places want in excess of $450. The camera itself is just as good as it's previous models (I have the SX40 and loved it) and in many cases better. It's a really good camera.
customer_reviews.author: FSC

customer_reviews.title: The camera did what I needed it to do, ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera did what I needed it to do, particularly with telephoto shots. I primarily used it on Auto, and other than a few blurred pictures (it took a few seconds to focus in some cases), it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: lcleary

customer_reviews.title: Amazing zoom pictures
customer_reviews.text: I had an SX40, dropped in pond and killed it. This is a good replacement, although not as good as the 40. Still learning the settings, can’t beat the ZOOM!
customer_reviews.author: Belinda A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I do love this Canon Powershot SX60
customer_reviews.text: I do love this Canon Powershot SX60. I've used Canon cameras for many, many years and have always had good experiences with them. I love the zoom feature on this one for capturing closeups of birds, wildlife and flowers. I would recommend this camera as a trusty one to reach for when going out looking for photo opportunities.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Using for birding, shots at a distance. Sometimes doesn't focus. No manual focus, but overall, working out well. Much lighter than my big camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you'll like it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing! This color rendition is spot on. Close up and zoom photo capabilities eliminate the need for extra lens purchases. At times it takes a few seconds to refocus. I can live with that as I'm not a sports event photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Carl

customer_reviews.title: Happy Guy.
customer_reviews.text: I decided that there was no reason to haul around a 5D markII and lenses anymore so bought the SX60HS. Fairly new yet but think this was a very good idea!
customer_reviews.author: C. T.

customer_reviews.title: Good starter camera
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, takes great photos and excellent quality video. Good camera for the price, and perfect for someone who wants something more than a point-and-shoot. Easy to use. I only wish that it had a cable for downloading the images instead of requiring the use of wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Charity and Al H

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I "downgraded" from a Canon DSLR to this camera in order to get an all-in-one zoom lens, I took if with me on a trip to Germany and love it. I do wish the EVF was a bit bigger, but otherwise I love this camera. Can't wait to use it on my next trip - hiking in the Grand Canyon at the end of this month.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly P. Bristol

customer_reviews.title: Woulld recommend for anyone
customer_reviews.text: This camera arrived very quickly and in great shape. The camera itself is a great little camera. I have a more expensive Canon camera that I use a lot...this one is a bit smaller and easier to take to some events. The camera takes great photos and is simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce O. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera, it did a good job while we were traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hild

customer_reviews.title: Camera with no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to purchase this camera. It came with no instructions at all. If I don’t have instructions, I will have to return it. It’s a gift, so please let me know ASAP as what my options are.
customer_reviews.author: Sossy Aharonian

customer_reviews.title: Delivery was super fast & packed excellent
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was super fast & packed excellent, l keep a list of fast deliveries, ( if it's slo no mo) the canon SX60 is awesom! The 65x zoom is GREAT!!! outdoor photos R gorgeous,inside are ok if U experiment wth. lighting.next month going 2 take pictures of American Pharoah who is only 10 mi. from Frankfort Ky. Can't wait!! Will send pics.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Lane

customer_reviews.title: Wi-fi is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Camera works very well .Wi-fi is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Copley

customer_reviews.title: Great improvements!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with his purchase. I had an older version that I liked, but I dropped it and the viewfinder no longer worked. I love the improvements on this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Beth M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cameras I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: So many great features, The one I like best is that it out focus the removable lenses!
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Kuhl

customer_reviews.title: Love my new camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my new camera. Does everything as expected and more. The zoom is incredible. Was able to capture my sons graduation perfectly
customer_reviews.author: C. Demuth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use....fun to play with shots on vacations
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Canon-only person and this is my 3rd PowerShot. It's a fun camera and great to take on active vacations that don't afford the time to change lens and adjust settings. I 'play' around with this all the time on vacations.
customer_reviews.author: D Currin

customer_reviews.title: good as the previous model
customer_reviews.text: bought for boss. He likes it a lot. Simple and good photos
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very good camera, the zoom is one of the best ...
customer_reviews.text: A very good camera, the zoom is one of the best that I have ever used. Very user friendly and easy to use. One of the best cameras ive used.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Voigt

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used, correctly represented to be "like new". I am happy with this purchase, have put this camera through a lot of use, and have gotten excellent results. The powerful telephoto lense, coupled with an amazing stabilization system is unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: lawhoc

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Competition
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought and ultimately returned the competition's 83x zoom camera, which I found to have rather soft images and slow AF (especially during video). In comparison, the Canon IQ is noticeably sharper and the AF much snappier, so I was happy to sacrifice some zoom range to get better images. I've owned a couple other brand's super-zoom and find the Canon SX60 to be the perfect compromise of quality and reach in the current crop of super-zooms.
customer_reviews.author: UG

customer_reviews.title: Incredible zoom
customer_reviews.text: The zoom on this camera is awesome. The online manual is 200+ pages, so there are a lot of settings and things you can do that I'll probably never understand. I just leave it on automatic settings and it still takes very good photos. Like I said before, if nothing else, the zoom lens blows any other away by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good bridge camera
customer_reviews.text: Comparable with my canon sl2 minus the auto focus system on this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Arcieri

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, fast shipping, good packaging. The lens cap sucks, but the overall camera is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: BillM

customer_reviews.title: Top Of The Line Camera
customer_reviews.text: Oh man!!! This is the best camera I have ever owned and I would not trade it or sell it to anyone. You get great photos from this camera, it is absolutely great for anyone to own and I recommend it highly!! So many features also make this a number one camera to own
customer_reviews.author: anewdawn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera the zoom is great easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: linda wettig

customer_reviews.title: Great all around point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! this is the 3rd brand of camera that I have been through in less then 2 years. The zoom by far is easier to manage for stability without a tripod! It does far better in low light situations and that was my biggest complaint of all the other cameras.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLu

customer_reviews.title: Great features, nice photos!
customer_reviews.text: Big upgrade from my Lumix. So far the pictures have been nice! I am puzzled by the autofocus though - has cost me shots due to it taking too long to focus - mostly far shots zooming in. Need to learn it more I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Murph

customer_reviews.title: Great for youtube
customer_reviews.text: I recently started my beauty YouTube channel and this camera has been perfect! I didn't want to spend an ton starting off but I'm so glad I found this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Canon Powershot SX60 16.1MP Digital Camera 65x Optical Zoom Lens 3-inch LCD Tilt Screen (Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:9543B001With Canon's Power Shot SX60 HS digital camera, you will zoom like never before to see craters on the moon, wildlife from afar and your child's face on a crowded school stage. The Power Shot SX60 HS gives you the reach to capture it all. The camera's astonishing 65x optical zoom (21mm-1365mm) wide-angle lens with Optical Image Stabilizer combine tremendous flexibility with portable ease. A 16.1 megapixel high-sensitivity CMOS sensor and Canon's latest DIGIC 6 image processor together create the Canon HS System for excellent low-light performance. Advanced technology including Zoom Framing Assist and Intelligent IS help you track and capture clear, steady long shots. Shoot realistic 1080p full HD video recorded at 60p. USM and VCM technology help ensure fast, silent zooming and focus during recording, and, in a first for a Power Shot model, you can attach an optional external microphone. Quickly share everything you capture. The Power Shot SX60 HS is Wi-Fi and NFC enabled with an easy Mobile Device Connect button.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

ZOOM LIKE NEVER BEFORE
Craters on the moon, wildlife from afar, your child's face on a crowded school stageâ€¦ the PowerShot SX60 HS camera gives you the reach to capture it all. The camera's astonishing 65x Optical Zoom (21mm–1365mm) Wide-Angle Lens with Optical Image Stabilizer combines tremendous flexibility with portable ease. Capture close-ups, wide shots and everything in between with beautiful quality thanks to a 16.1 Megapixel* High-Sensitivity CMOS Sensor and Canon's latest DIGIC 6 Image Processor that together create the Canon HS SYSTEM for excellent low-light performance. Advanced technology including Zoom Framing Assist and Intelligent IS help you track and capture clear, steady long shots. Shoot realistic 1080p Full HD video recorded at 60p. USM and VCM technology help ensure fast, silent zooming and focus during recording, and, in a first for a PowerShot model, you can attach an optional external microphone. And quickly share everything you capture: the PowerShot SX60 HS is Wi-Fi®**- and NFC-enabled*** with an easy Mobile Device Connect button.

* Image processing may cause a decrease in the number of pixels.
** Compatible with iOS versions 6.0/6.1/7.0/7.1, Android smartphone versions 2.3.3/4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3/4.4 and Android tablet versions 4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3/4.4. Data charges may apply.
*** Compatible with Android devices version 4.0 or later

ULTRA ZOOMING POWER IN THE PALM OF YOUR HANDS
65X OPTICAL ZOOM (21–1365MM) WIDE-ANGLE LENS WITH OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER FOR OUTSTANDING OPTICAL PERFORMANCE AND VERSATILITY FOR BOTH CLOSE-UPS AND WIDE SHOTS
Imagine having the power to capture animals in the wild from a safe distance, shoot architectural details atop a skyscraper, and see the expression on an athlete's face from up in the stands – all from a compact camera with a built-in lens. Lightweight with superb controllability, the 65x Optical Zoom lens on the PowerShot SX60 HS camera is a marvel of optical engineering; but it's also a Genuine Canon Lens, which means that the images you capture with it will be beautifully natural and true to life – whether you're shooting at the wide angle or extreme telephoto end.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND FAST PERFORMANCE START HERE
16.1 MEGAPIXEL* HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera employs a 16.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.

* Image processing may cause a decrease in the number of pixels.

CANON DIGIC 6 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera is equipped with the very latest Canon proprietary processor, the DIGIC 6 Image Processor, which makes several important advancements to image quality both in stills and video. Improved light sensitivity allows for higher resolution with less noise when shooting in dark conditions, and Dynamic IS now detects and compensates for tilt and parallel movement (shift blur) to create video that's exceptionally free of distortion. The DIGIC 6 Image Processor also enhances the performance capabilities of the PowerShot SX60 HS, powering full resolution high-speed continuous stills shooting. And video recording is better than ever, as the DIGIC 6 Image Processor enables Full HD at 60p, as well as MP4 recording. Highly compressed MP4 video not only preserves space on your memory card but also improves playback on mobile devices.

CANON HS SYSTEM
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 16.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with Canon's latest-generation DIGIC 6 Image Processor to create the Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 3200; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos, even when shooting video.

RAW MODE
The PowerShot SX60 HS lets you shoot in RAW mode, which records all the information captured by the sensor, giving you outstanding flexibility and complete creative control when editing your images with Canon's powerful software. The camera also allows you to record in RAW and JPEG formats simultaneously. Now, in RAW mode, you can even select among several aspect ratios, including 16:9, 3:2, 4:3, 1:1 and 4:5.

SERIOUS VIDEO AND AUDIO CAPABILITY
1080P FULL HD VIDEO AND EXTERNAL MICROPHONE SUPPORT
With the PowerShot SX60 HS camera, you'll preserve memories and creative film clips in beautifully realistic 1080p Full HD Video at 60 frames per second. The quality is especially apparent when you play back your video on a large-screen HDTV via the camera's HDMI output. Simply press the dedicated Movie button to begin recording. And now for the first time on a PowerShot model, a new input allows you to attach an optional external microphone (⌀3.5mm) for serious audio recording to match the high-quality video you'll capture. The camera's powerful zoom is equipped with Canon's precision-engineered Ultrasonic Motor (USM) and Voice Coil Motor (VCM) for fast, silent zooming and focus that won't interfere with audio capture. Advanced videographers will appreciate the camera's Manual movie mode that lets you adjust aperture and shutter speeds, and ISO speed either before or during video capture for enhanced creative control.

The PowerShot SX60 HS also records video in the Apple iFrame® format, a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, so uploading and emailing high-quality video is quick and easy. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, so you won't have to make time-consuming conversions that can degrade quality.

SIMPLY TAP TO CONNECT
BUILT-IN WI-FI® AND NFC (NEAR FIELD COMMUNICATION) FOR EASIER CONNECTIVITY
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera supports NFC (Near Field Communication) technology, eliminating the need to manually find and open the Canon CameraWindow app* on your mobile device. Simply touch the NFC icon on your camera to your compatible Android™ device**, and the CameraWindow app will launch automatically for quick, easy sharing of your images. Built-in NFC technology also makes it simpler to install the app. If the app hasn't been installed yet, once you touch the devices together for the first time, the download screen will display automatically.

BUILT-IN WI-FI® MAKES SHARING QUICK AND EASY
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera is equipped with built-in Wi-Fi® technology for on-the-go convenience when you want to share your photos and videos with friends, family and the whole world. Easily post your images to social networking and media sites – Facebook®, Twitter®, YouTube™, Flickr®, and Google Drive™ – through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY# directly from your PowerShot camera, or save them to the online photo album to share anytime, anywhere. The camera can also connect directly to both iOS® and Android™ devices##, and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app without a computer. You can control the destination of your uploads to share with everyone or to selected groups, and even add comments. Sharing video is also easy with the PowerShot SX60 HS, which records video using the easy-to-share MP4 format. Enhanced Wi-Fi® makes posting in real time possible, so you can keep everyone up to date with photos and video even as events unfold. The built-in Wi-Fi® technology on the PowerShot SX60 HS also allows you to transfer images to other Wi-Fi® equipped PowerShot cameras or print your photos directly to a PictBridge (Wireless LAN) certified printer.

REMOTE SHOOTING
With the built-in Wi-Fi® on the PowerShot SX60 HS, you can use your smartphone or tablet## to remotely control the camera. Simply connect wirelessly to your device and access the free Canon CameraWindow app*. Your device will show a live image of the camera's capture for easy composition – perfect for wildlife and nighttime shots, group photos and all kinds of situations. The camera's versatile zoom, flash, self-timer and shutter are all under your control, with images being saved to your camera as usual.

MOBILE DEVICE CONNECT BUTTON
One-touch connection to your mobile device or computer is made possible on the PowerShot SX60 HS with the camera's dedicated Mobile Device Connect Button. You can choose to transfer images to your smartphone or tablet for immediate sharing with the CameraWindow app, or to your computer on the same network with Image Sync to make saving and organizing your images easier. When the camera finds a linked computer on the same wireless network, images are sent directly to it. Otherwise, images are temporarily stored on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY then transferred once a connection is made, eliminating the need for cables.

* This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
** Compatible with Android devices version 4.0 or later.
# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY online photo album.
## Compatible with iOS versions 6.0/6.1/7.0/7.1, Android smartphone versions 2.3.3/4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3/4.4 and Android tablet versions 4.0/4.1/4.2/4.3/4.4. Data charges may apply.

OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM EIGHT DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR VIRTUALLY SHAKE-FREE IMAGES IN A WIDE VARIETY OF CONDITIONS
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot SX60 HS camera, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system automatically analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system selects from Normal IS, Panning IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and Tripod modes. When shooting video, the system selects from Dynamic IS, Powered IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and Active Tripod IS modes. New icons clearly mark the image stabilization mode, whether you're shooting still images or video.

STILL IMAGE SHOOTING
Normal IS Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning IS Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. VIDEO RECORDING
Dynamic IS Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered IS Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for motion blur that is likely to occur when shooting video while walking. Also compensates for the shift-type camera shake common in macro shooting. Active Tripod IS When shooting video while using a tripod, the image stabilization is active to compensate for slight camera shake. EASIER TRACKING AND CAPTURE
ZOOM FRAMING ASSIST AND ZOOM MEMORY
Its 65x Optical Zoom lens gives the PowerShot SX60 HS camera the ability to capture subjects at great distances, but because it can be challenging to track a moving subject at maximum telephoto, the camera includes sophisticated technology to help you get the most from the camera's powerful zoom while simply enjoying shooting. When you press and hold the Zoom Framing Assist button, the camera will zoom out to include a wider angle of view, enabling you to more easily locate your moving subject. Once you find it, releasing the button will cause the lens to return to its original zoom position, intelligently keeping the subject in focus until you're ready to shoot and capture the perfect close-up moment. You can even make zoom adjustments while the button is pressed, with an animated assist frame that makes viewing easy. When the button is released, the lens will return to the adjusted zoom position. Zoom Framing Assist also lets you select an image area (Face/Upper Body/Whole Body/Manual), then keeps that area of your subject the same size in your frame no matter how the subject moves. For instance, you can tap the Zoom Framing Assist button to detect your subject's face. As your subject retreats and advances the camera automatically zooms in and out so their face remains the same size. It's especially useful for capturing the expressions of fast-moving children, and for letting a friend take a picture after you've composed the shot. And, for even more convenience, the Zoom Framing Assist function is also available when shooting video.

A new Zoom Memory function lets you save the zoom position and return to it immediately when you power the camera on. You can also save a Manual Focus position. This is especially convenient at times when you want to power off during short breaks while remaining ready to shoot immediately, for instance if you're waiting for clouds to pass by, or changing the camera's SD card or battery.

FASTER FOCUS FOR ACCURACY, SPONTANEITY
HIGH SPEED AF
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera is equipped with Canon's remarkably responsive High Speed AF. This High Speed AF technology achieves an increase in speed for quicker start up and a shooting experience that's spontaneous and natural. And a speedier AF means it's possible to photograph fast-moving subjects, which complements the PowerShot SX60 HS's High-Speed Burst HQ mode. You'll capture great shots as they happen – frame by frame – with reduced lag time.

CONVENIENT SHOOTING FLEXIBILITY
BRIGHT 3.0-INCH VARI-ANGLE LCD WITH 922,000 DOTS FOR SHOOTING AT A VARIETY OF ANGLES, PLUS AN ELECTRONIC VIEWFINDER WITH 922,000 DOTS FOR SHOOTING
The PowerShot SX60 HS camera gives you lots of ways to frame a great shot. The bright 3.0-inch Vari-angle LCD has excellent resolution (approximately 922,000 dots), and flips out and swivels/rotates for shooting at unusual angles, even letting you capture perfectly framed self-portraits. The camera also has an Electronic Viewfinder (approximately 922,000 dots) to easily see subjects when using the camera in very bright sunlight, or preventing camera shake by holding it steadily.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
ENHANCED GRIP
The carefully designed grip on the PowerShot SX60 HS camera was specifically developed to make high-magnification shooting easy and accurate. Substantially sized and tall enough for your whole hand to hold securely, the grip is very comfortable and adds a distinctive professional style. The camera's design allows easy access to controls (like access to a convenient front dial), and maximizes camera angle flexibility with the Vari-angle LCD screen to allow you to handle the camera like you would an SLR for optimal control.

EXTRA ACCESSORIES
Experience the PowerShot SX60 HS camera's full potential using accessories that are normally used with EOS DSLR cameras. The PowerShot SX60 HS is compatible with Canon Speedlites, transmitters, and select filter adapters and lens hoods to help maximize the camera's versatility photographers need to achieve their creative vision.

HDR
Shooting in high-contrast environments can often result in photos with overexposed and underexposed sections. To tackle this problem, Canon developed the High Dynamic Range shooting mode to make shooting even more intuitive. Under High Dynamic Range, the camera will shoot three different exposures in a succession (underexposed, overexposed and normal) and then merge them into a single image. Underexposed areas are combined with the overexposed and vice versa, resulting in an evenly detailed image with flattering shadows and highlights. With the PowerShot SX60 HS camera, a tripod is not always necessary, plus the camera features artistic sub-modes Art Standard, Art Vivid, Art Bold, Art Embossed and Natural, which add dynamic, creative effects depending on the ambience you want to convey.

CREATIVE SHOT
Rather than randomly applying filters, Creative Shot mode takes advantage of advanced Canon technologies to analyze the individual scene, subject and exposure to apply any of 46 filter options. In addition to the original shot, the camera automatically produces and saves five additional variations of the composition. Filter choices are grouped into Retro, Monochrome, Special and Natural categories to make exploring the world of artistic photography fun and easy, or simply select Auto to access the full range of effects. With Creative Shot mode, the result is stunning artistic photos that are perfect for sharing.

SMART AUTO
Smart AUTO for the PowerShot SX60 HS camera makes it easier than ever to capture the sharp, bright, colorful images and videos you're looking for. By assessing various factors in both the background and the subject, the system recognizes 58* predefined shooting situations and automatically selects the camera settings that will yield the best possible results. Simply frame the shot you want, and in dozens of common or challenging scenarios the camera takes care of the rest. Hard-to-capture shots such as moving subjects, night scenes, backlit subjects and landscapes in the evening or on a bright, snowy day are instantly and effortlessly captured as "keeper" shots. Smart AUTO makes the PowerShot SX60 HS ideal for capturing excellent quality still images and video on the go.

* 58 predefined shooting situations for still images, and 21 predefined shooting situations for video.

HYBRID AUTO
Capture the essence of special days – vacations, important occasions or any time you're shooting many shots in a day – using Hybrid Auto on the PowerShot SX60 HS camera. Hybrid Auto records up to four seconds of video every time you shoot a still image, then automatically joins the day's clips and pictures* into a video. The feature also makes sure the "highlight reel" is stunningly beautiful by automatically recognizing the scene and optimizing camera settings to capture the highest possible image quality. The resulting 720p HD video is properly exposed, crisp and steady.

* Pictures can be withheld from the resulting video via menu settings.

65x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom and 260x combined zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer.Video Clip Length Up to 29 Min 59 Sec
